solution.text:
Loudness of sound \(=_{k}_\) dB
Amplitude of vibration \(=_{j}_\) cm
Factor by which amplitude increases \(= _{l}_\)
We already know, Loudness \(=\) Amplitude\(^2\).
Therefore, the loudness of sound corresponding to the new amplitude of vibration \(=_{l}_^2 \times _{k}_\)
\(=_{{l**2}}_ \times _{k}_=_{{l**2*k}}_\)
New loudness of sound \(=_{{l**2*k}}_\) dB

content.text: If the loudness of sound for a \(_{j}_\) cm amplitude of vibration is \(_{k}_\) dB, what will be the loudness of sound if the amplitude increases by \(_{l}_\) times?
